title: Day 3 protest: Farmers to block trains today, hold round 3 talks with Centre
Body: Several major farmers’ unions have extended their support to the protesting farmer unions at Shambhu border and Khanauri border in Punjab, with the Bharatiya Kisan Union (Ugrahan) and BKU Dakaunda (Dhaner faction) announcing a ‘rail roko’ (stop trains) in the state on Thursday between 12 noon and 4 pm on Thursday, February 15. The Samyukt Kisan Morcha, an umbrella body of 37 farm unions, have also supported the ongoing protests. The protesters are demanding a minimum support price or MSP for their crops.
caption: A protester uses water to disperse tear gas, as farmers march towards New Delhi to press for better crop prices promised to them in 2021, at Shambhu, a border crossing between Punjab and Haryana. (REUTERS)

title: Electoral bonds case LIVE updates: Supreme Court to deliver key verdict today at 10:30am
What are electoral bonds? What is the argument against poll funding?
Body: The Supreme Court on Thursday is set to pronounce its verdict on a batch of petitions challenging the validity of the electoral bond scheme - a mechanism that allows anonymous funding to political parties. A five-judge bench headed by chief justice of India DY Chandrachud had reserved its judgment in the matter on November 2 last year. The other judges included justices Sanjiv Khanna, BR Gavai, JB Pardiwala, and Manoj Misra.
caption: Supreme Court on Thursday is set to pronounce its verdict on a batch of petitions challenging the validity of the electoral bond scheme

title: Wrestlers Bajrang Punia, Sakshi Malik threaten fresh protest after Brij Bhushan's son gets key post
Body: India's ace wrestlers Bajrang Punia and Sakshi Malik have issued a fresh warning to start their protest again in response to the appointment of Karan Bhushan Singh, the son of former Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) president Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, as the president of the Uttar Pradesh Wrestling Association.
caption: BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh (ANI)

title: Farmers' protest: Delhi traffic advisory for Wednesday | Here are the routes to avoid
Body: Day after farmers began their ‘Chalo Delhi’ protest, Delhi Police issued a fresh traffic advisory on Wednesday.
caption: Police and Rapid Action Force (RAF) personnel block a highway to prevent farmers from marching towards India's capital. (AFP)

title: Farmers continue to besiege Punjab-Haryana borders; fresh talks today
Body: Protesting farmers continued to besiege the Punjab-Haryana borders following a fresh face-off with security personnel at Shambhu and Jind on Wednesday even as a panel of Union ministers was scheduled to have a third round of negotiations on Thursday as part of efforts to resolve the crisis that has threatened to spill over into Delhi. Security forces have fortified the national capital with barricades and advanced surveillance equipment.
caption: Farmers running for cover on Wednesday. (REUTERS)

title: Mamata Banerjee may visit Punjab on Feb 21, to meet Kejriwal, Mann
Body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee may visit Punjab on February 21 and meet her Delhi and Punjab counterparts, Arvind Kejriwal and Bhagwant Mann respectively, an official source said on Thursday.
caption: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee. (ANI Photo)

title: Farmers Protest highlights: Police drop tear gas via drones, get countered by kites
caption: Haryana police fired tear gas with drone during the farmers protest at Shambu border of Punjab and Haryana near Ambala on Wednesday. Photo by Ravi Kumar/ Hindustan Times

title: Farmers Protest LIVE Updates: Protesting farmers to meet Centre today
